channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO

item.title: Report X-2024021258
item.description:
Report X-2024021258

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FULLY LABELLED HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING FROM A CORNER OF THE BOX WAS DISCOVERED BY A LOADER ON THE PD 2. THE LOADER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR WHO THEN CONTACTED THE DMP. WITHIN 3 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE APPROPRIATE PPE. USING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON ONE OF THE INNER 2 LITER PLASTIC CONTAINERS WAS LOOSE BY 1/8 OF A TURN AND 1 OUNCE OF LIQUID HAD LEAKED OUT ONTO THE OUTER PACKAGING. THE INNER CONTAINERS WERE INDIVIDUALLY WRAPPED IN PLASTIC BAGS AND THERE WAS NO OTHER PACKING MATERIAL.

item.title: Report E-2024020367
item.description:
Report E-2024020367

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 8, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1268 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately fifty (50) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. ER personnel deployed absorbents to the released material and worked them in using hand tools. The damaged 55-gallon drum was overpacked in one (1) 85-gallon overpack. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized in seven (7) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024020366
item.description:
Report X-2024020366

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-17
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was recovered from the 1-3-5 Unload and placed in a lined tote. DescribePack: The spill was found in a trailer from another facility. The package was loaded incorrectly (on its side), and the contents had also developed loose caps which allowed for a spill to occur. Two of the four containers lost liquid and sustained denting. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in the Haz cage under the vent due to its strong fumes.

item.title: Report I-2023120010
item.description:
Report I-2023120010

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T00:33:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-30
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: THE KANSAS CITY SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 2210 on 10/30/2023 CPKC personnel reported seeing an exhaust coming out of the top of a loaded hazmat car, TILX 112325, at the CPKC Knoche yard in Kansas City, MO. The CPKC Hazmat Department mobilized, along with a response contractor, to investigate and mitigate the release. Upon assessment, responders found that the pressure relief device (PRD) had actuated releasing approximately 0.5 gallons of commodity. The tank car was then moved with reacher cars to an isolation track where it was decontaminated to a 7 pH. The package was inspected and not found to be overloaded or over pressured. CPKC Hazmat concluded that the PRD might be defective. The shipper was contacted and advised that the tank car is currently a FRA non-specification package and required that the PRD be tested and proved to be functioning, or replaced by a qualified MRU. Shipper was also made aware that the car would need a FRA OTMA before it could be moved. As of the date of this filing, the shipper and car owner are working to verify proper PRD operation before the car will be released back into rail transportation. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best information available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a 'bulk' shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.
